column3: I don't think we need this special case.\nWhat's wrong with bitcoin-main.lnk?\n
It's not the same filename being used presently. Thus, users with 0.11 autostarting would see the checkbox uncheck itself, and checking it would result in trying to autostart twice...\n
nit: `s/strprintf("bitcoin-%s.lnk", chain) / "bitcoin-"+chain+".lnk"`? But maybe a matter of taste.\n
Depends on from where you come :-) But of course this should be C++ ;-)\n
I used this `+ "" +` syntax a lot in earlier days but I don't think this is suitable for a project like bitcoin: The `"+something+"` syntax usually produces unreadable and nasty diffs when changed.\n

No strong opinion. Just wanted to say that `strprintf` in a non-std function brought in over a tiny headers only library (tinyformat) and the + " " + syntax will very likely result in simpler and faster machine code.\n
This is only called once per invocation of the application at most, so let's not micro-optimize.\n
